text: The M6 Toll, also called the Birmingham North Relief Road (BNRR) or Midland Expressway, is a toll motorway in the Midlands, opened in 2003. It is used as a way to avoid the traffic on the M6 motorway by Birmingham. It goes from the M6 at Coleshill to the M6 at Wolverhampton. It is a toll road, so drivers have to pay to use it. ==Junctions== {| style="margin-left:1em; margin-bottom:1em; color:black; font-size:90%;" class="wikitable" |- style="background:#0080d0; Vehicles using only this five-mile section do not have to pay a toll. ==Notes== ==References== Category:Motorways in England
